description: From Latin fātidicus, from fātum (“fate”) + dico (“I speak”).

adjectives.description: fatidic (comparative more fatidic, superlative most fatidic)

entries.meaning: (now rare) Of or pertaining to prophecy; prophetic
examples: At that moment he felt quite proud of his stratagem. He was to recall it with a fatidic shiver seventeen years later [...].
